newsitem.title: USA: Novell EPS up despite lower revenue.
newsitem.headline: Novell EPS up despite lower revenue.

text.p: Novell Inc on Tuesday attributed a decline in its fourth quarter revenue to the sale or discontinuation of product lines in the past year.
Novell said it earned $0.17 a share in the quarter ended October 31, compared with $0.16 a share in the year ago period.
Revenues in the quarter fell to $383.7 million from $480.5 million a year ago. The earnings figure matched the First Call mean estimate of brokers.

Revenues in the fourth quarter rose five percent from the third quarter levels and were driven by "strong demand" for new versions of major products, Novell said. Revenues from Novell server software rose 15 percent over the third quarter.
The company reiterated its prime goal of establishing Novell Directory Services (NDS) as the de facto industry standard for the Internet/intranet markets.
